original: @549b rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @549b rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ku m'a ra drishd'anta s'u tra /
analyzed: ku m'a ra drishd'anta s'u tra /
translated: Kumāradṛṣṭānta-sūtra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: gzhon nu dpe'i mdo /
analyzed: gzhon nu dpe'i mdo /
translated: The Sutra of the Youth's Parables

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /🔽bcom ldan 'das ko sa la'i ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang mnyan yod du byon nas mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na / bcom ldan 'das ko sa la'i ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang mnyan yod du byon nas mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time,🔽the Blessed One was traveling through the country of Kosala and arrived at Śrāvastī. He stayed in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada near Śrāvastī.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge sbyong goo ta ma ko sa la'i ljongs rgyu zhing  gshegs pa dang mnyan yod du byon nas mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge sbyong goo ta ma ko sa la'i ljongs rgyu zhing  gshegs pa dang mnyan yod du byon nas mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala heard that the ascetic Gautama, while traveling through the country of Kosala, had arrived at Śrāvastī and was staying in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada near Śrāvastī.

original: shes ldan goo ta ma de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas par bdag nyid zhal gyis 'che'o //
analyzed: shes ldan goo ta ma de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas par bdag nyid zhal gyis 'che'o //
translated: “Sir Gautama, I have heard that you claim to have realized unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: zhes thos so //
analyzed: zhes thos so //
translated: This is what I heard.🔽

original: thos nas kyang bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig mngon du yang dag par dga' ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: thos nas kyang bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig mngon du yang dag par dga' ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba'i gtam rnam pa sna tshogs byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Having heard this, he went to where the Blessed One was staying. When he arrived, he sat down to one side and had a variety of pleasant and joyful conversations with the Blessed One.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas koo sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas koo sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he had sat down to one side, King Prasenajit of Kosala said to the Blessed One,

original: kye goo ta ma /🔽bdag gis shes ldan goo ta ma bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @550a *//🔽chub mngon par sangs rgyas par bdag nyid zhal gyis 'che'o //
analyzed: kye goo ta ma / bdag gis shes ldan goo ta ma bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @550a *// chub mngon par sangs rgyas par bdag nyid zhal gyis 'che'o //
translated: “O Gautama,

original: zhes thos lags na /
analyzed: zhes thos lags na /
translated: I have heard that you claim to have realized unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽”🔽“Yes, indeed, great king, I have realized unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: goo ta ma gang dag de skad ces lung bstan pa de dag ji ga dge sbyong goo ta ma la skur ba 'debs pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: goo ta ma gang dag de skad ces lung bstan pa de dag ji ga dge sbyong goo ta ma la skur ba 'debs pa ma lags sam /
translated: “Gautama, are those who prophesy like that slandering the ascetic Gautama?

original: thal bar smra ba ma lags sam /
analyzed: thal bar smra ba ma lags sam /
translated: Are they speaking nonsense?

original: shes ldan goo ta mas gsungs pa bzhin smra ba lags sam /
analyzed: shes ldan goo ta mas gsungs pa bzhin smra ba lags sam /
translated: Are they speaking in accordance with what the honorable Gautama has said?🔽Are they speaking Dharma?

original: chos smra ba lags sam; chos dang mthun pa'i chos lung ston pa lags sam /
analyzed: chos smra ba lags sam; chos dang mthun pa'i chos lung ston pa lags sam /
translated: Are they teaching Dharma in accordance with the Dharma?

original: ji ga de dag gi drung du pha rol po chos dang mthun par rtsod pa'i rjes su rtsod pa mchis na /
analyzed: ji ga de dag gi drung du pha rol po chos dang mthun par rtsod pa'i rjes su rtsod pa mchis na /
translated: If others debate with them in accordance with the Dharma,

original: smod pa'i chos kyi gnas su mi 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: smod pa'i chos kyi gnas su mi 'gyur lags sam /
translated: will they not be subject to criticism?”

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great King,

original: gang dag de skad du smra ba de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag de skad du smra ba de dag ni /
translated: those who speak like that

original: de skad du lung stong pa bden te /
analyzed: de skad du lung stong pa bden te /
translated: are speaking the truth.

original: nga la skur ba 'di 'debs pa ma yin /
analyzed: nga la skur ba 'di 'debs pa ma yin /
translated: They are not slandering me.

original: thal par smra ba ma yin /
analyzed: thal par smra ba ma yin /
translated: They are not speaking nonsense.

original: de ni / gsungs pa bzhin smra ba yin /
analyzed: de ni / gsungs pa bzhin smra ba yin /
translated: They are speaking in accordance with what I have said.

original: chos dang mthun pa'i chos lung ston pa yin te /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa'i chos lung ston pa yin te /
translated: They are teaching Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de dag gi drung du pha rol po chos dang mthun pa'i rtsod pa'i rjes su rtsod pa 'ongs nas smod pa'i chos kyi gnas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi drung du pha rol po chos dang mthun pa'i rtsod pa'i rjes su rtsod pa 'ongs nas smod pa'i chos kyi gnas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to come to debate with me in accordance with the Dharma, I would not be a subject for their criticism.”

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great King,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas so; ;shes ldan goo ta ma /🔽de skad mod kyi /
analyzed: ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas so; ;shes ldan goo ta ma / de skad mod kyi /
translated: ‘I have awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’🔽‘Sir Gotama, that is so,

original: shes ldan goo ta ma /
analyzed: shes ldan goo ta ma /
translated: but, sir Gotama,

original: bdag yid mi ches lags so //
analyzed: bdag yid mi ches lags so //
translated: I do not believe it.’

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: ‘Why is that?’

original: kye goo ta ma /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma /
translated: ‘Hey, Gautama,

original: re zhig rgan zhing rgan pa'i dge sbyong @550b dang / bram ze ni /
analyzed: re zhig rgan zhing rgan pa'i dge sbyong @550b dang / bram ze ni /
translated: there are these old, old ascetics and brahmins🔽who are

original: 'di dag lags te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di dag lags te /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: 'od srung rdzogs byed dang / kun tu rgyu gnag lhas kyi bu dang / smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu yang dag rgyal ba can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang / ka tya'i bu nog can dang / gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu gang lags pa de dag kyang da dung bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bdag nyid g-yar gyis mi 'che lags na /
analyzed: 'od srung rdzogs byed dang / kun tu rgyu gnag lhas kyi bu dang / smra 'dod kyi bu mo'i bu yang dag rgyal ba can dang / mi pham skra'i la ba can dang / ka tya'i bu nog can dang / gcer bu pa gnyen gyi bu gang lags pa de dag kyang da dung bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bdag nyid g-yar gyis mi 'che lags na /
translated: Kāśyapa, Kakuda-Kātyāyana, Sañjayin-Vairaṭṭīputra, Ajita-Keśakambala, Kaṭhina-Kātyāyana, and Jñāti-Pūraṇa-Kāśyapa, have not yet attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes ldan goo ta ma 'khrungs nas ring po ma lags pa gsar du rab tu byung bas lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
analyzed: shes ldan goo ta ma 'khrungs nas ring po ma lags pa gsar du rab tu byung bas lta smos kyang ci 'tshal /
translated: How much less so the one who has been a renunciant for a short time, who has recently gone forth, the honorable Gautama.”

original: rgyal po chen po /🔽gzhon nu bzhi po 'di dag la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po / gzhon nu bzhi po 'di dag la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
translated: “Great King,

original: zil gyis mnan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan par mi bya ste /
translated: you should not disparage or overpower these four youths.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: rgyal rigs gzhon nu khyad du gsad par mi bya; gzhon nu la zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs gzhon nu khyad du gsad par mi bya; gzhon nu la zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
translated: you should not disparage or overpower a young kṣatriya.

original: rgyal po chen po /🔽sbrul gzhon nu la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po / sbrul gzhon nu la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
translated: Great King,🔽you should not despise a young snake,

original: gzhon nu la zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu la zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
translated: nor should you overpower a youth.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: me chung ngu la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
analyzed: me chung ngu la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
translated: you should not despise a small fire,

original: zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
translated: nor should you overpower it.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: dge slong gzhon nu la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong gzhon nu la khyad du gsad par mi bya /
translated: you should not despise a young monk,

original: gzhon nu la zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu la zil gyis mnan par mi bya'o //
translated: nor should you overpower a youth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: dge slong gzhon nur gyur kyang de rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba'i dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gzhon nur gyur kyang de rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba'i dgra bcom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if a monk is young, he may become an arhat with great miraculous powers and great strength.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces //
translated: The Blessed One having spoken thus,

original: bka' stsal nas ni bde gshegs @551a *//
analyzed: bka' stsal nas ni bde gshegs @551a *//
translated: the Sugata,

original: kyis; ;de skad ces ni bka' stsal nas //
analyzed: kyis; ;de skad ces ni bka' stsal nas //
translated: having spoken thus,

original: ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad gsungs //
analyzed: ston pas gzhan yang 'di skad gsungs //
translated: the Teacher spoke further:🔽To a kṣatriya endowed with incomparable qualities,🔽to one of noble lineage and renown,

original: rgyal rigs dpe med ldan pa dang // rigs btsun grags par ldan pa la; ;blo dang ldan pas de gzhon zhes //
analyzed: rgyal rigs dpe med ldan pa dang // rigs btsun grags par ldan pa la; ;blo dang ldan pas de gzhon zhes //
translated: the wise one should not despise him as 'young'

original: khyad du mi gsad zil mi mnan //
analyzed: khyad du mi gsad zil mi mnan //
translated: and should not overpower him.

original: rgyal po rgyal rigs mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: rgyal po rgyal rigs mkhas pa yis //
translated: “ ‘The wise king and the wise kṣatriya,

original: rgyal srid dag ni thob gyur nas //
analyzed: rgyal srid dag ni thob gyur nas //
translated: Having obtained the kingdom,🔽Are tormented by that place of killing with punishment.

original: chad pas gsod pa'i gnas de yod; ;de bas de la shin tu gdung //
analyzed: chad pas gsod pa'i gnas de yod; ;de bas de la shin tu gdung //
translated: Therefore, one should be very careful about that.

original: de ltar rang gi srog srung zhing //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi srog srung zhing //
translated: “ ‘Thus, protecting one’s own life

original: rang gi don la lta bas ni //
analyzed: rang gi don la lta bas ni //
translated: And looking out for one’s own benefit,

original: de ni khyad du mi gsad cing //
analyzed: de ni khyad du mi gsad cing //
translated: One should not despise it

original: de la legs par bag kyang bya //
analyzed: de la legs par bag kyang bya //
translated: And should be very careful about it.

original: gal te grong ngam dgon pa'ang rung //
analyzed: gal te grong ngam dgon pa'ang rung //
translated: “ ‘Whether in a village or a forest,

original: gang du sbrul ni mthong gyur na //🔽blo dang ldan pas de gzhon zhes //
analyzed: gang du sbrul ni mthong gyur na // blo dang ldan pas de gzhon zhes //
translated: Wherever one sees a snake,🔽The wise one should not despise it,

original: khyad du mi gsad zil mi mnan //
analyzed: khyad du mi gsad zil mi mnan //
translated: Thinking, “It is young.”

original: 'di ltar sbrul ni rgyu ba na //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbrul ni rgyu ba na //
translated: “ ‘For when a snake moves,

original: rigs ni rnam pa sna tshogs la //
analyzed: rigs ni rnam pa sna tshogs la //
translated: Its various types

original: glags rnyed nas ni gzhon nus kyang //
analyzed: glags rnyed nas ni gzhon nus kyang //
translated: Can seize an opportunity and, even if young,

original: skyes pa bud med du ma zin //
analyzed: skyes pa bud med du ma zin //
translated: Can kill many men and women.

original: de ltas rang gi srog srung zhing //
analyzed: de ltas rang gi srog srung zhing //
translated: “ ‘Thus, protecting one’s own life

original: rang gi don la lta bas ni //
analyzed: rang gi don la lta bas ni //
translated: And looking out for one’s own benefit,

original: de ni khyad du mi gsad cing //
analyzed: de ni khyad du mi gsad cing //
translated: One should not despise it🔽And should be very careful about it.

original: de la legs par bag kyang bya; ;'bar ba mang ba za byed pa //
analyzed: de la legs par bag kyang bya; ;'bar ba mang ba za byed pa //
translated: “ ‘The one who eats much that is burning

original: byin za lam sngon ldan pa de //
analyzed: byin za lam sngon ldan pa de //
translated: The one who possesses the path of the past is the one who devours the enjoyments.🔽

original: chung yang khyad du mi gsad cing //
analyzed: chung yang khyad du mi gsad cing //
translated: Even if the fire is small, do not despise it,🔽and do not extinguish it with water.

original: mkhas pas zil gyis mnan mi bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas zil gyis mnan mi bya //
translated: The wise do not suppress it.

original: nye bar len pas byin za ni //
analyzed: nye bar len pas byin za ni //
translated: The fire of the future that is fed by the fuel of appropriation

original: chung ngur gyur las chen por 'gyur //
analyzed: chung ngur gyur las chen por 'gyur //
translated: becomes great even if it is small.

original: me lce 'bar bas myur bar ni //
analyzed: me lce 'bar bas myur bar ni //
translated: A blazing fire quickly burns

original: grong dang grong khyer sreg par byed //
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer sreg par byed //
translated: villages and towns.

original: de phyir bdag srog srung byed pas //
analyzed: de phyir bdag srog srung byed pas //
translated: Therefore, those who protect their own lives

original: de ni khyad du mi gsad cing //
analyzed: de ni khyad du mi gsad cing //
translated: should not despise it.

original: bdag nyid don la @551b legs lta bas //
analyzed: bdag nyid don la @551b legs lta bas //
translated: Those who are skilled in their own welfare

original: de la legs par bag kyang bya //🔽byin za lam sngon ldan gyur pa'i //
analyzed: de la legs par bag kyang bya // byin za lam sngon ldan gyur pa'i //
translated: should be careful with it.🔽The fire that is fed by the fuel of the future

original: me yis tshang tshing gang bsregs pa //
analyzed: me yis tshang tshing gang bsregs pa //
translated: burns up the forest.

original: de la nyin mtshan 'das gyur pas //
analyzed: de la nyin mtshan 'das gyur pas //
translated: When day and night pass

original: la lar lo ma skye bar 'gyur //🔽gang gis tshul khrims ldan pa yi //
analyzed: la lar lo ma skye bar 'gyur // gang gis tshul khrims ldan pa yi //
translated: sometimes leaves grow.

original: dge slong rnyed nas sreg byed pa //🔽de la bu dang tsha bo dang // mgo skal yod par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: dge slong rnyed nas sreg byed pa // de la bu dang tsha bo dang // mgo skal yod par mi 'gyur te //
translated: Those who burn up a monk who is endowed with moral discipline🔽will not have sons, grandsons,🔽or any heirs,

original: ta la'i mgo bzhin mi ring bar //
analyzed: ta la'i mgo bzhin mi ring bar //
translated: like the palm tree, which does not bear fruit.

original: rigs rgyud dang yang bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rigs rgyud dang yang bral bar 'gyur //
translated: And will be deprived of his lineage.

original: de phyir bdag srog srung byed pas //
analyzed: de phyir bdag srog srung byed pas //
translated: Therefore, in order to protect one’s own life,

original: de na khyad du gsad mi bya //
analyzed: de na khyad du gsad mi bya //
translated: One should not despise him.

original: bdag nyid don la legs lta bas //
analyzed: bdag nyid don la legs lta bas //
translated: Having well considered one’s own purpose,

original: de la legs par bag kyang bya //
analyzed: de la legs par bag kyang bya //
translated: One should be careful with him.🔽The one who has the characteristics of a kṣatriya,

original: rgyal rigs dpe byad ldan pa dang // brang 'gro me dang de bzhin du //
analyzed: rgyal rigs dpe byad ldan pa dang // brang 'gro me dang de bzhin du //
translated: The one who is a brāhmaṇa, and likewise the one who is a fire,

original: dge slong tshul khrims ldan pa de //
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims ldan pa de //
translated: And the bhikṣu who has moral discipline,

original: mkhas pas zil gyis mnan mi bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas zil gyis mnan mi bya //
translated: The wise one should not overpower them.

original: de phyir bdag srog srung byed pas //
analyzed: de phyir bdag srog srung byed pas //
translated: Therefore, in order to protect one’s own life,

original: de ni khyad du gsad mi bya //
analyzed: de ni khyad du gsad mi bya //
translated: One should not despise them.

original: bdag nyid don la legs lnga pas //
analyzed: bdag nyid don la legs lnga pas //
translated: Having well considered one’s own purpose,

original: de ni legs par spang bar bya //
analyzed: de ni legs par spang bar bya //
translated: One should be careful with them.

original: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par bstod cing rjes su yi rang ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas phyir song ngo //
analyzed: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par bstod cing rjes su yi rang ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas phyir song ngo //
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala, having praised and rejoiced in the Blessed One’s words, bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: gzhon nu dpe'i mdo rdzogs so //
analyzed: gzhon nu dpe'i mdo rdzogs so //
translated: The Sūtra of the Youthful Simile is complete.
